item.title: Metabolomics
item.description: Metabolomics allows the comprehensive profiling of hundreds to thousands of small molecules present within a system. By using this approach, we can understand how metabolic changes (in plants, cells, animals, or people) are affected by our research question, and generate new ideas we may not be able to a priori hypothesize. Here is some work we’ve published on the topic: Bilbrey EA, Williamson K, Hatzakis E, Doud Miller D, Fresnedo Ram√≠rez J, Cooperstone JL.

item.title: Phytochemical analysis
item.description: In order to understand what phytochemicals are doing within a system, robust and quantitative methods are required for their analysis. We focus on developing liquid chromatography and mass spectrometry based methods to allow analysis of phytochemicals and their metabolites, often present at picomolar concentrations. Here is some work we’ve published on the topic: Dzakovich MP, Hartman JL, Cooperstone JL. A high-throughput extraction and analysis method for steroidal glycoalkaloids in tomato.
